      <title>We Rejoice in Hope of the Glory of God</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/we-rejoice-in-hope-of-the-glory-of-god-jj5fdi7w-en/landscape/we-rejoice-in-hope-of-the-glory-of-god-jj5fdi7w-aea35ba0064b70636c56c46aabc82aa1.jpg?ts=1759947282&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>

      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>In this life of affliction, suffering, and groaning, Christians always have reason to rejoice in hope of the eternal glory of God.</description>
      <pubDate>Wed, 22 Oct 2025 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.desiringgod.org/messages/we-rejoice-in-hope-of-the-glory-of-god</link>
      <itunes:keywords>Desiring God, John Piper, Message, Hope, Romans 5:1–2</itunes:keywords>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">desiringgod.org-resource-20043</guid>
      <enclosure url="https://audio.desiringgod.org/20251022-en-we-rejoice-in-hope-of-the-glory-of-god.mp3?ts=1759947736" length="69465255" type="audio/mpeg"/>
      <media:content url="https://audio.desiringgod.org/20251022-en-we-rejoice-in-hope-of-the-glory-of-god.mp3?ts=1759947736" medium="audio" expression="full">
        <media:title>We Rejoice in Hope of the Glory of God</media:title>

        <media:description type="html">The circumstances for world missions may seem forbidding. But if we wait for the optimal time to become or send a missionary, then we won’t.</media:description>

        <media:description type="html">Why does the apostle Paul speak so much about himself and his suffering? Because his suffering for the sake of others makes the love of Christ tangible to them.</media:description>

    <item>
      <title>How to Find Gold in God’s Word: Reading the Bible with Supernatural Help</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/discover-gold-in-god-s-word-no7hi3kn-en/landscape/discover-gold-in-god-s-word-no7hi3kn.JPG?ts=1506702255&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>
      <itunes:subtitle>Reading the Bible with Supernatural Help</itunes:subtitle>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>00:53:27</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>

        <media:description type="html">Jesus demands the impossible, whole-hearted love for God and others, but he does not abandon us to the task.</media:description>

        <media:description type="html">In suffering, we come to hope more fully in God and put less confidence in the things of the world. We also come to know Christ better when we share his sufferings. </media:description>
        <media:player url="https://media.blubrry.com/3817470/audio.desiringgod.org/20140302-en-preparing-to-know-christ-deeply-through-suffering.mp3?ts=1705532688"/>
        <media:thumbnail url="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>

      <title>Living by Faith in Future Grace</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/living-by-faith-in-future-grace-mf4amctq-en/landscape/living-by-faith-in-future-grace-mf4amctq-8d96af293df4d666a27565dbeb11b15a.jpg?ts=1540583913&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>

      <itunes:duration>00:45:29</itunes:duration>

    <item>
      <title>Skeptical Grumbling and Sovereign Grace</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/skeptical-grumbling-and-sovereign-grace-8rju6mdh-en/landscape/skeptical-grumbling-and-sovereign-grace-8rju6mdh-8bc33b0b91c4b2d15f62f7b2167dde91.jpg?ts=1542813203&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>00:49:57</itunes:duration>

    <item>
      <title>This Is the Judgment: Light Has Come into the World</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>00:48:21</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>Jesus didn't come to a neutral world. He came to those already dead and guilty to make some alive and free.
      </description>

    <item>
      <title>Jesus Christ and the Rescue of Joy, Part 1</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/jesus-christ-and-the-rescue-of-joy-xgtdidoj-en/landscape/jesus-christ-and-the-rescue-of-joy-xgtdidoj-e7b7c2397c245fa1bd20433eaadbfef5.jpg?ts=1561735712&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>
      <itunes:subtitle>Part 1</itunes:subtitle>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>00:50:50</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>

      <title>Welcome One Another for the Glory of God</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/welcome-one-another-for-the-glory-of-god-adtonngp-en/landscape/welcome-one-another-for-the-glory-of-god-adtonngp-141e112a9c231285c52fefdf1f9e70cf.jpg?ts=1648693599&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>

      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>When we accept and welcome one other across barriers and boundaries as Christ did for us, not only is God glorified, but our joy in him expands in the joy of others.</description>
      <pubDate>Tue, 01 Jul 2008 15:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.desiringgod.org/messages/welcome-one-another-for-the-glory-of-god</link>
      <itunes:keywords>Desiring God, John Piper, Message, Life Together, Romans 15:1–9</itunes:keywords>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">desiringgod.org-resource-4334</guid>
      <enclosure url="https://media.blubrry.com/3817470/audio.desiringgod.org/20080701-en-welcome-one-another-for-the-glory-of-god.mp3?ts=1704483385" length="0" type="audio/mpeg"/>
      <media:content url="https://media.blubrry.com/3817470/audio.desiringgod.org/20080701-en-welcome-one-another-for-the-glory-of-god.mp3?ts=1704483385" medium="audio" expression="full">
        <media:title>Welcome One Another for the Glory of God</media:title>
        <media:description type="html">When we accept and welcome one other across barriers and boundaries as Christ did for us, not only is God glorified, but our joy in him expands in the joy of others.</media:description>

    <item>
      <title>The Origin of the Unwasted Life</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>01:02:04</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>If God is magnified in our showing that he is valuable by treasuring him above all things — if that’s what the unwasted life is — then something has to happen to us, because we don’t do that by nature.</description>
      <pubDate>Sat, 29 Mar 2008 15:00:00 +0000</pubDate>

    <item>

    <item>
      <title>When Is Abortion Racism?</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/when-is-abortion-racism-jowvzfcj-en/landscape/when-is-abortion-racism-jowvzfcj.jpg?ts=1507653479&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>00:38:10</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>White abortionists kill more black and Hispanic babies than they do white babies every year. Abortion is a racist institution.</description>
      <pubDate>Sun, 21 Jan 2007 15:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.desiringgod.org/messages/when-is-abortion-racism</link>
      <itunes:keywords>Desiring God, John Piper, Message, Abortion, Ephesians 5:16–17</itunes:keywords>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">desiringgod.org-resource-4251</guid>
      <enclosure url="https://media.blubrry.com/3817470/audio.desiringgod.org/20070121-en-when-is-abortion-racism.mp3?ts=1704313557" length="9243385" type="audio/mpeg"/>
      <media:content url="https://media.blubrry.com/3817470/audio.desiringgod.org/20070121-en-when-is-abortion-racism.mp3?ts=1704313557" medium="audio" expression="full">
        <media:title>When Is Abortion Racism?</media:title>
        <media:description type="html">White abortionists kill more black and Hispanic babies than they do white babies every year. Abortion is a racist institution.</media:description>

      <title>Why Expositional Preaching Is Particularly Glorifying to God</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/why-expositional-preaching-is-particularly-glorifying-to-god-vrfd6j2o-en/landscape/why-expositional-preaching-is-particularly-glorifying-to-god-vrfd6j2o-30aecd49848f30c508f56f6ce17f0aa9.png?ts=1524245601&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>

    <item>
      <title>Dare All Things by the Word of God: John Calvin and His Preaching</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>

      <link>https://www.desiringgod.org/messages/dare-all-things-by-the-word-of-god</link>

      <title>Why We Eat the Lord's Supper, Part 1</title>

    <item>
      <title>The Supremacy of God in the Use of Your Mind</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/the-supremacy-of-god-in-the-use-of-your-mind-hq7qexck-en/landscape/the-supremacy-of-god-in-the-use-of-your-mind-hq7qexck-3e1bf5889d1b536f855a649c1c09d5d6.jpg?ts=1674842742&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>01:05:30</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>The supremacy of God in the life of the mind is manifested by the conscious, worshipful experience of God’s supremacy in the use of one’s mind together with an intentional display it in one’s mental work.</description>
      <pubDate>Tue, 25 Feb 2003 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.desiringgod.org/messages/the-supremacy-of-god-in-the-use-of-your-mind</link>
      <itunes:keywords>Desiring God, John Piper, Message, Life of the Mind</itunes:keywords>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">desiringgod.org-resource-17296</guid>
      <enclosure url="https://audio.desiringgod.org/20030225-en-the-supremacy-of-god-in-the-use-of-your-mind.mp3?ts=1703021410" length="0" type="audio/mpeg"/>
      <media:content url="https://audio.desiringgod.org/20030225-en-the-supremacy-of-god-in-the-use-of-your-mind.mp3?ts=1703021410" medium="audio" expression="full">
        <media:title>The Supremacy of God in the Use of Your Mind</media:title>
        <media:description type="html">The supremacy of God in the life of the mind is manifested by the conscious, worshipful experience of God’s supremacy in the use of one’s mind together with an intentional display it in one’s mental work.</media:description>

      <title>The Path and the Price of Pursuing the Glory of God Among the Nations</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>

      <itunes:duration>00:39:53</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>Filling up what is lacking in Christ’s afflictions means that we embrace suffering for the sake of bringing a personal presentation of the sufferings of Christ to the nations. </description>
      <pubDate>Sun, 22 Oct 2000 15:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.desiringgod.org/messages/the-path-and-the-price-of-pursuing-the-glory-of-god-among-the-nations</link>

        <media:title>The Path and the Price of Pursuing the Glory of God Among the Nations</media:title>
        <media:description type="html">Filling up what is lacking in Christ’s afflictions means that we embrace suffering for the sake of bringing a personal presentation of the sufferings of Christ to the nations. </media:description>
        <media:player url="https://media.blubrry.com/3817470/audio.desiringgod.org/20001022-en-the-path-and-the-price-of-pursuing-the-glory-of-god-among-the-nations.mp3?ts=1702580079"/>
        <media:thumbnail url="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>

    <item>
      <title>God Demonstrates His Love Toward Us</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/god-demonstrates-his-love-toward-us-odkky5v4-en/landscape/god-demonstrates-his-love-toward-us-odkky5v4-82a6958f1a8d93e3a1771089e15e44b3.jpg?ts=1511883861&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>00:29:37</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>

      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>In Jesus Christ, worship is not centered on a place or form, but on his person and work. All true worship is to him and through him.</description>

    <item>
      <title>Finishing What?</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://dg.imgix.net/finishing-what-fqda1qxy-en/landscape/finishing-what-fqda1qxy-5053d220abec0017cdcd8b17e20df994.jpg?ts=1644634302&amp;ixlib=rails-4.3.1&amp;auto=format%2Ccompress&amp;fit=min&amp;w=800&amp;h=450"/>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>00:44:34</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>Finishing well will not happen without a fight, and God is the decisive finisher who will powerfully work in us so that he alone gets the glory. </description>
      <pubDate>Thu, 01 Oct 1998 13:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.desiringgod.org/messages/finishing-what</link>
      <itunes:keywords>Desiring God, John Piper, Message, World Missions</itunes:keywords>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">desiringgod.org-resource-2428</guid>
      <enclosure url="https://media.blubrry.com/3817470/audio.desiringgod.org/19981001-en-finishing-what.mp3?ts=1702411251" length="0" type="audio/mpeg"/>
      <media:content url="https://media.blubrry.com/3817470/audio.desiringgod.org/19981001-en-finishing-what.mp3?ts=1702411251" medium="audio" expression="full">
        <media:title>Finishing What?</media:title>
        <media:description type="html">Finishing well will not happen without a fight, and God is the decisive finisher who will powerfully work in us so that he alone gets the glory. </media:description>
        <media:player url="https://media.blubrry.com/3817470/audio.desiringgod.org/19981001-en-finishing-what.mp3?ts=1702411251"/>

        <media:description type="html">Pastors much preach the beauty of holiness to awaken contrition over lack of holiness. Preaching beauty begets contrition which begets radical obedience. </media:description>

    <item>
      <title>Joy in God as the Heart of Worship</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>01:17:20</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>The heart of worship is being satisfied in God, therefore, we must pursue our joy in God.</description>
      <pubDate>Mon, 14 Apr 1997 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.desiringgod.org/messages/joy-in-god-as-the-heart-of-worship</link>
      <itunes:keywords>Desiring God, John Piper, Message, Christian Hedonism</itunes:keywords>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">desiringgod.org-resource-17769</guid>
      <enclosure url="https://audio.desiringgod.org/19970414-en-joy-in-god-as-the-heart-of-worship.mp3?ts=1702320784" length="0" type="audio/mpeg"/>
      <media:content url="https://audio.desiringgod.org/19970414-en-joy-in-god-as-the-heart-of-worship.mp3?ts=1702320784" medium="audio" expression="full">

    <item>
      <title>I Have Authority to Lay It Down and I Have Authority to Take It Up Again</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>
      <itunes:subtitle>Easter Sunday</itunes:subtitle>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>00:26:38</itunes:duration>
      <dc:creator>John Piper</dc:creator>
      <description>The story of Easter doesn't end with a mangled shepherd lying dead
      among three dead wolves.
      </description>
      <pubDate>Sun, 11 Apr 1993 15:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.desiringgod.org/messages/i-have-authority-to-lay-it-down-and-i-have-authority-to-take-it-up-again</link>

      <guid isPermaLink="false">desiringgod.org-resource-3997</guid>

      <title>Daniel's Defiance of Darius in Prayer</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>

      <title>What God Has Cleansed Do Not Call Common</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>
      <itunes:subtitle>Missions Week</itunes:subtitle>

      <itunes:duration>00:34:47</itunes:duration>

      saved if no one had taken him the gospel. And no one will be saved
      today without the gospel.

        <media:description type="html">Faithfulness is better than anything and everything this life can offer. The reward the Lord will give surpasses any earthly treasure.</media:description>

      <title>The Guilt of Giving Part of God's Counsel</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>

    <item>
      <title>Prayer at Harvest Time: Now!</title>
      <itunes:image href="https://www.desiringgod.org/assets/2/custom/podcasts/audio-4a96f58e8589f94975725672a7b1d7809b3f07b1dbe143f07d92c69acfe6e36f.jpg"/>
      <itunes:author>John Piper</itunes:author>
      <itunes:duration>00:40:02</itunes:duration>

        <media:description type="html">When we clamor for praise, we are prideful and petty. But when God commands us to praise him, he is loving us to the uttermost.</media:description>
